item.title: [PI/Any] Math Command

item.description:
@itai wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:6, topic:439997”][quote author=itai link=topic=542679.msg3977249#msg3977249 date=1334792130]

snippet

If a mod thinks so, then a mode can lock it. You posting “snippet” is both unneeded and unwanted.
[/quote]
It’s needed because your IQ obviously isn’t high enough to realize it yourself.

[quote]
When Posting a New Tutorial
When you are posting a new tutorial, be sure that it covers all of the following:

It shows some effort put into it -- it's your work, show some pride!
It's a tutorial relevant directly to RuneScape 2 Private Servers and nothing else.

Any code snippets provided have been thoroughly explained with careful detail.
Make sure that the work you post is only yours, unless you have permission to post someone else’s work and accredit them appropriately. Stealing work is not tolerated here.
You may post a tutorial that has already been created if and only if it surpasses any existing tutorials of its type.
[/quote][/quote]
No, it really isn’t. You are not a mod, and if a mod wants to move it or lock this they can; also, if you really have to resort to implying I have a low IQ then you shouldn’t even bother posting.

item.title: [PI/Any] Math Command
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

[B]
A friend of mine has a server, and his players wanted a math command. So I wrote this up relatively quick for him and though I would release to anyone who wants to use it. It’s pretty neat.

In your Misc class add this at the top:

import javax.script.ScriptEngine; import javax.script.ScriptEngineManager;
Then somewhere else in the class add:

[CODE] private static ScriptEngineManager manager = new ScriptEngineManager();
private static ScriptEngine engine = manager.getEngineByName(“JavaScript”);

public static int parse(String text){
	try{
	Double d = (Double) engine.eval(text);
	return d.intValue();
	}catch(Exception e){
		throw new NumberFormatException(e.getLocalizedMessage());
	}
}[/CODE]

Then in your Commands class add:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("math")){ c.sendMessage(String.valueOf(Misc.parse(playerCommand.substring(playerCommand.indexOf(' ') + 1)))); }
And you are done, you can go in-game and type something like: ::math ((4*3)+8)/2 and get the answer :D[/B]

Read full topic
